bill.title: Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2023
bill.description: To amend section 1115 of title 31, United States Code, to amend the description of how performance goals are achieved, and for other purposes.

history.action: Introduced in House
Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Ordered to be Reported in the Nature of a Substitute (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Ms. Norton moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H3880-3881)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2617.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H5497-5498)
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 414 - 10 (Roll no. 304). (text: CR 7/26/2021 H3880)
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.
Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Peters with amendments. With written report No. 117-164.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 506.
Passed Senate with amendments by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S6704; text: CR S6704)
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

House agreed to Senate amendments numbered 1, 2, 3, and 5, and the House agreed to Senate amendment numbered 4 with an amendment pursuant to H. Res. 1518 (consideration: CR H9745-9752; text: CR H9790-9803)
Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendment to Senate amendment 4.
Motion to proceed to consideration of the House message to accompany H.R. 2617 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 70 - 25. Record Vote Number: 403.
Measure laid before Senate by motion.
Motion by Senator Schumer to concur in the House amendment to Senate amendment SA 4 to H.R. 2617 with an amendment (SA 6552) made in Senate.
S.Amdt.6572 Amendment SA 6572 proposed by Senator Schumer. To add an effective date.
S.Amdt.6571 Amendment SA 6571 proposed by Senator Schumer to Amendment SA 6552. To add an effective date.
S.Amdt.6573 Amendment SA 6573 proposed by Senator Schumer to Amendment SA 6572 (the instructions of the motion to refer). To modify the effective date.
S.Amdt.6552 Amendment SA 6552 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Leahy. In the nature of a substitute.
S.Amdt.6574 Amendment SA 6574 proposed by Senator Schumer to Amendment SA 6573. To modify the effective date.

Motion by Senator Schumer to refer to Senate Committee on Appropriations the House message to accompany H.R. 2617 with instructions to report back forthwith with the following amendment (SA 6572) made in Senate.
Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S9719, S9735, S9739-9740, S9759)
S.Amdt.6574 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S9719)
S.Amdt.6573 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S9719)
S.Amdt.6572 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S9719)
S.Amdt.6571 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S9719)
S.Amdt.6552 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S9719)
Cloture motion on the motion to concur in the House amendment to Senate amendment SA 4 to H.R. 2617 with an amendment (SA 6552) presented in Senate. (CR S9759)
Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S10062-10077)

Motion by Senator Schumer to refer to Senate Committee on Appropriations the House message to accompany H.R. 2617 with instructions to report back forthwith with the following amendment (SA 6572) withdrawn in Senate by Unanimous Consent. (CR S10075)

Resolving differences -- Senate actions: Senate concurred in the House amendment to Senate amendment SA 4 to H.R. 2617 with an amendment (SA 6552), under the order of 12/22/22, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, by Yea-Nay Vote. 68 - 29. Record Vote Number: 421.
S.Amdt.6576 Amendment SA 6576 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

S.Amdt.6577 Amendment SA 6577 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Lankford to Amendment SA 6558. (consideration: CR S10069-10070; text: CR S10062) To establish a rule of construction relating to religious entities.

S.Amdt.6588 Amendment SA 6588 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Padilla to Amendment SA 6552. (consideration: CR S10071; text: CR S10063) To amend title VI of the Social Security Act to allow States and local governments to use coronavirus relief funds provided under the American Rescue Plan Act for infrastructure projects, improve the Local Assistance and Tribal Consistency Fund, provide Tribal governments with more time to Coronavirus Relief Fund payments, and for other purposes.
S.Amdt.6577 Amendment SA 6577 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 44 - 53. Record Vote Number: 414.

S.Amdt.6576 Amendment SA 6576 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Lee to Amendment SA 6552. (consideration: CR S10069; text: CR S10063) To provide for the continuation of pay and benefits for Lieutenant Ridge Alkonis.
S.Amdt.6574 SA 6574 fell when SA 6573 fell.
S.Amdt.6572 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S10062)
S.Amdt.6571 Proposed amendment SA 6571 withdrawn in Senate.
S.Amdt.6572 Proposed amendment SA 6572 withdrawn in Senate.
S.Amdt.6573 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S10062)
S.Amdt.6574 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S10062)
S.Amdt.6573 SA 6573 fell when SA 6572 was withdrawn.
S.Amdt.6588 Amendment SA 6588 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
S.Amdt.6595 Amendment SA 6595, under the order of 12/22/22, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 92 - 5. Record Vote Number: 417.
S.Amdt.6607 Amendment SA 6607 as modified, under the order of 12/22/22, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 90 - 6. Record Vote Number: 419.

S.Amdt.6607 Amendment SA 6607 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Gillibrand to Amendment SA 6552. (consideration: CR S10064-10065, S10071-10074; text: CR S10071-10072) To establish a World Trade Center Health Program Supplemental Fund.
S.Amdt.6617 Amendment SA 6617 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Menendez to Amendment SA 6552. To improve the Justice for the United States Victims of State Sponsored Terrorism Act.
S.Amdt.6617 Amendment SA 6617, under the order of 12/22/22, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 93 - 4. Record Vote Number: 420.

S.Amdt.6621 Amendment SA 6621 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Sinema to Amendment SA 6552. (consideration: CR S10068; text: CR S10062-10063) To appropriate amounts for the Executive Office for Immigration Review, U.S. Customs and Border Protection, U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement, the Federal Emergency Management Agency, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services, refugee and entrant assistance, and other Federal agencies.
S.Amdt.6597 Amendment SA 6597, under the order of 12/22/22, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 88 - 8. Record Vote Number: 418.
S.Amdt.6597 Amendment SA 6597 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Klobuchar to Amendment SA 6552. (consideration: CR S10073; text: CR S10093-10094) To improve the bill.
S.Amdt.6621 Amendment SA 6621, under the order of 12/22/22, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 10 - 87. Record Vote Number: 412.
S.Amdt.6571 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S10062)

S.Amdt.6596 Amendment SA 6596 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Graham to Amendment SA 6552. (consideration: CR S10063, S10071-10072; text: CR S10063) To authorize the transfer of the proceeds of certain forfeited property to help Ukraine recover from the harms caused by the ongoing Russian aggression.
S.Amdt.6596 Amendment SA 6596 as modified agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

S.Amdt.6595 Amendment SA 6595 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Merkley to Amendment SA 6552. (consideration: CR S10072-10073; text: CR S10063) To amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to expand access to breastfeeding accommodations in the workplace, and for other purposes.
S.Amdt.6563 Amendment SA 6563 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 47 - 50. Record Vote Number: 413.
S.Amdt.6555 Amendment SA 6555 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 34 - 63. Record Vote Number: 410.

S.Amdt.6558 Amendment SA 6558 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Cassidy to Amendment SA 6552. (consideration: CR S10070-10071; text: CR S10063) To eliminate discrimination and promote women's health and economic security by ensuring reasonable workplace accommodations for workers whose ability to perform the functions of a job are limited by pregnancy, childbirth, or a related medical condition.
S.Amdt.6555 Amendment SA 6555 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Johnson to Amendment SA 6552. (consideration: CR S10067; text: CR S10062) To eliminate all earmarks in the bill.
S.Amdt.6569 Amendment SA 6569, under the order of 12/22/22, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 40 - 57. Record Vote Number: 415.
S.Amdt.6552 Considered by Senate (Message from the House considered). (consideration: CR S10075-10077)

S.Amdt.6552 Point of order that the motion to concur in the House amendment to amendment SA 4 with an amendment (SA 6552) violates section 306 of the CBA raised in Senate with respect to amendment SA 6552.
S.Amdt.6558 Amendment SA 6558, under the order of 12/22/22, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 73 - 24. Record Vote Number: 416.

S.Amdt.6552 Motion to waive all applicable budgetary disciple with respect to the motion to concur in the House amendment to amendment SA 4 with an amendment (SA 6552) agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 65 - 31. Record Vote Number: 408.

S.Amdt.6559 Amendment SA 6559 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Johnson to Amendment SA 6552. (consideration: CR S10067-10068) To restrict the use of Federal funds appropriated to the Department of Homeland Security for the transportation of illegal aliens within the United States.
S.Amdt.6569 Amendment SA 6569 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Braun to Amendment SA 6558. (consideration: CR S10070; text: CR S10062) To eliminate a waiver of State immunity.

S.Amdt.6563 Amendment SA 6563 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Lee to Amendment SA 6552. (consideration: CR S10068-10069; text: CR S10063) To prohibit the expenditure of Federal funds to terminate the prohibitions on entry into the United States that are commonly referred to as Title 42.
S.Amdt.6561 Amendment SA 6561, under the order of 12/22/22, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 34 - 63. Record Vote Number: 409.
S.Amdt.6559 Amendment SA 6559, under the order of 12/22/22, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 47 - 50. Record Vote Number: 411.

S.Amdt.6561 Amendment SA 6561 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Paul to Amendment SA 6552. (consideration: CR S10066; text: CR S10062) To increase the voting threshold for budget points of order.

Senate concurred in the House amendment to Senate amendment SA 4 to H.R. 2617 with an amendment (SA 6552), under the order of 12/22/22, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, by Yea-Nay Vote. 68 - 29. Record Vote Number: 421.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

Resolving differences -- House actions: On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the Senate amendment Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 225 - 201, 1 Present (Roll no. 549).
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1531, Ms. DeLauro moved to agree to the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2617.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1531, Ms. Deluaro moved to agree to the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2617.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on the motion to agree to the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the Senate amendment to H.R. 2617.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment to the House amendment to the Senate amendment Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 225 - 201, 1 Present (Roll no. 549).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.

calendar.description: House Committee on Oversight and Reform Hearing
Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Hearing
